Importing Files

You can import media anywhere you see an + Add Media button or icon (library_add), including on the cue editor, in the media manager, and on the bottom toolbar. Click the button/icon to open the file dialog and select one or more audio files.

Imported media files are copied to the project's media collection, so it is safe to move or delete the originals. If the project already has a file of the same name, it will be overwritten.

The Media Manager

You can access the Media Manager from the Project Menu (settings) in the bottom-left.

Assigned and Unassigned Media

On the left of the Media Manager you will see a list of all the media files in the project. Any files that have been copied to the project but haven't been assigned to cues will be listed under Unassigned Media, while all the files assigned to cues are listed under Assigned Media.

If a category has no cues, it will not be shown.

Media Details

When you select a media file on the left, on the right will appear a details pane with additional information about the selected file, and an audio player where you can preview the track.

  • File name of the currently-displayed file
  • Link to file (open_in_browser) to view the file on your computer
  • File size on disk, in kilobytes
  • Date and time the file was added/modified
Assigning Cues

Below the preview player will be a list of all the cues this media file is assigned to (if any), with the name of the cue and the page/section in which it appears. You can delete a cue by clicking on the delete icon (delete).

If no cues are assigned to this media file, the Delete Media button will remove this media file from the project. Deleting the media file will reduce the disk size of your project but cannot be undone, so you'll need the original file if you want to add it back later.
